wiki.content: "Because" is a ballad written by John Lennon (credited to Lennon/McCartney) and performed by The Beatles. It features a 3-part harmony vocal performance between Lennon, McCartney and George Harrison, overdubbed three times to make nine voices in all. The results of this have been compared in sound to The Beach Boys. It appeared on the 1969 album Abbey Road, and is the song that precedes the extended medley that formed side two of the original LP record. "Because" by The Beatles was inspired by Beethoven's "Moonlight Sonata" ... BACKWARDS. John Lennon tells the story of the origin of that song: I was lying on the sofa in our house, listening to Yoko play Beethoven's "Moonlight Sonata" on the piano. Suddenly, I said, "Can you play those chords backward?" She did, and I wrote "Because" around them. The song sounds like "Moonlight Sonata," too. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: "Because" is a ballad written by John Lennon (credited to Lennon/McCartney) and performed by The Beatles. It features a 3-part harmony vocal performance between Lennon, McCartney and George Harrison, overdubbed three times to make nine voices in all. The results of this have been compared in sound to The Beach Boys. It appeared on the 1969 album Abbey Road, and is the song that precedes the extended medley that formed side two of the original LP record. "Because" by The Beatles was inspired by Beethoven's "Moonlight Sonata" ... BACKWARDS.

track.name: Because
comments: Supposedly, this is Beethoven's Moonlight sonata played backwards
me arrepio ouvindo essa música...
I know Come Together is a more popular song, but this is Lennon's finest moment on Abbey Road.
Wow, I think they fixed it for once.
Great song (maybe my favorite Beatles Song), but this is the Love version, not the Abbey Road version. Someone needs to get their info correct.
Alongside "Tomorrow Never Knows", "Because" is the Beatles' most innovative studio production and their most awe-inspiring track. Best use of the band's vocal harmonies.
beautiful....
Fascinating...but I miss the accompanying music. One of my favourite chord progressions.
Oh boy, How I love the Beatles soo soo much!<3
The Beatles...accapella!
Love version is haunting, to say the least.
because the sky is blue it makes me cry.
Gah soo beautiful in a capella!
background music of heaven [6]
background music of heaven [5]
because the wind is high it blows my mind
Dark and beautiful.
Beauty incarnate.
background music of heaven [4] EVERYTHING IS FUCKING PERFECT IN THIS SONG!!
